data.event: The area was first settled in 1865 by a Mormon group led by Peter Shirts.
After the end of the Black Hawk War in 1867 settlers began to arrive at a rapid pace.

event.title: produced good crops for several years

data.event: Farming produced good crops for several years, but irrigation was very difficult; each spring the surface runoff water was absorbed into the desert soil too quickly to properly water the fields.
In 1870 the residents agreed to move the settlement.
In 1871, John D. Lee came to the Paria area, fleeing investigators of the Mountain Meadows massacre.
